description: CRITICAL CONFIRMED: Local File Inclusion vulnerability allows reading arbitrary system files including /etc/passwd and Apache logs
notes:
CRITICAL VULNERABILITY CONFIRMED AND EXPLOITED:
1. Successfully read /etc/passwd using payload: post.php?id=../../../../etc/passwd
2. Successfully read Apache access logs: post.php?id=../../../../var/log/apache2/access.log
3. Log poisoning attack vector available - attacker can inject PHP code in User-Agent header, then include log file for RCE
4. Path traversal with ../ works across multiple levels
5. PHP wrappers (php://filter) appear to be blocked
6. No input validation or sanitization on the 'id' parameter
7. Potential for complete system compromise via log poisoning â†’ RCE
8. Can read sensitive files: configuration files, source code (if in readable locations), credentials, SSH keys
